reviews.text: We stayed here last week and were very impressed with the hotel as we were with Uppingham itself. We had a nice quiet well appointed room and a marvelous dinner that evening. Very good service with an excellent chef in the back preparing imaginative dishes. And all very reasonably priced. Breakfast as well was the same, toast when you wanted it with butter and preserves in dishes not peel off sachets, great coffee and local sausages from the next door butcher. All in all ab fab. We shall return.
reviews.title: An Oasis

reviews.text: Arriving on a cold grey wet winters day meant the courtyard looked uninviting and dreary however, I am assured by their website that during the warm bright summer months that a plethora of bedding plants and nicely welcoming outside seating areas brighten the place up to make it feel more inviting.

reviews.text: First impression when you get inside are fantastic, a very rustic, extremely smart and well presented bar area, a solid wooden bar with nice details and a quaint comfy seating area with the added attraction of a roaring open log fire to enjoy. The dining area in spacious, covers for about 30, in a bright inviting room which looks out onto the high street, dining at solid wooden tables, with nicely appointed details.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a one night stay at Lake Isle which included a 3 course meal and breakfast. Excellent price considering all it included (£155). The staff, breakfast and dinner were faultless. The de-luxe cottage (with whirlpool bath) we stayed in was cosy and we'd definitely go back, but there were a few improvements that could have been made just to make it perfect - for example.. a shelf was needed in the bathroom, a bin was needed in the bedroom, one of the lamps in the bedroom had no bulb in it, no shelf/dish in the shower to put your soap on, the bathroom door wouldn't close or lock, cobwebs on the ceiling of the bedroom and a coat hook by the front door would have been useful. None of this spoiled the stay though, we'll certainly be back.
reviews.title: lovely little get away and fab food :)

likes.disliked: — nothing major, just little imperfections niggled as they were so easy to correct

reviews.text: Just spent Christmas at the Lake Isle Hotel. We had three superb days with excellent food. The hotel, staff, food and wine were 1st class and we would thoroughly recommend the hotel and the town of Uppingham - also pop into The Vaults for a great welcome & some fine ales.
reviews.title: What a Christmas!

reviews.text: I found this hotel and restaurant by accident when I was originally booked into Barnsdale Country Club and walked out because of the awful room. I have stayed here on occasion now around 10 times and I have to say each time has been faultless. I am working my way around the rooms and all have been nice and very clean.
reviews.title: Perfect again

reviews.text: One of the reasons I keep returning is the fantastic restaurant. The menu has been vaired and seasonable on each visit. There is plenty of room around the tables and the service is fantastic. You never feel rushed. You can dress "smart casual" or dress up as you please. It feels informal not fussy which I think adds to the enjoyment.
reviews.title: Selfishly I'd like to keep this place a secret....
